item.title: Exporting Winlogbeat Logs to SOF-ELK
item.description: ğŸ” Purpose Enable structured Windows event logs to flow from OPFORGE’s Windows Member VM to SOF-ELK using Winlogbeat, a JSON exporter, and PowerShell automation. âœ… Prerequisites Windows 10/11 host joined to domain (e.g., OPF-MBR01) Winlogbeat installed and configured SSH access to SOF-ELK (e.g., elk_user@192.168.77.40) Valid PuTTY key pair (.ppk) for SCP transfers (if using PSCP) Target folder on SOF-ELK writable by elk_user (e.g., /logstash/kape/) ğŸ”§ Checkâ€“Doâ€“Check Workflow ğŸ” Check Confirm Winlogbeat is writing .

item.title: OPFORGE Status Overview
item.description: ğŸ§­ Project Status: OPFORGE This page tracks the current progress of OPFORGEâ€”covering infrastructure setup, log ingestion, threat emulation, and explainable detection pipelines. âœ… Foundation & Deployment Area Status Notes Domain Purchased âœ… opforge.dev via Cloudflare Hugo Static Site Created âœ… With PaperMod theme GitHub Repo Initialized âœ… opforge-site GitHub Actions CI/CD âœ… Deploys on push to main GitHub Pages Configured âœ… Using gh-pages branch Custom Domain Mapped âœ… Site live at https://opforge.

item.title: SOF-ELK Setup & Ingestion
item.description: ğŸ” Purpose Deploy and configure the SOF-ELK stack for ingestion of structured JSON logs from Winlogbeat and other sources inside the OPFORGE lab. âœ… Prerequisites VMware Workstation Pro VM: OPF-LOG01 Latest SOF-ELK Ubuntu-based image deployed Static IP assignment (e.g., 192.168.77.40) Inbound SSH/SCP and port 5044 (Beats input) allowed JSON-formatted Winlogbeat files structured for ingest ğŸ”§ Checkâ€“Doâ€“Check Workflow ğŸ” Check Confirm network interface and IP: ip a ip route ping -c 3 8.
